intro: Microspermum hintonii, commonly known as the Hinton's microspermum, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and finely divided leaves, which are typical of the carrot family. The plant is native to specific regions in China and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species. Its botanical study provides valuable insights into the ecological adaptations of plants in specialized ecosystems.
